keyword: [u'open data', u'transportation', u'bikeways', u'pedestrian', u'traffic counts']
title: Pedestrian Count Screen Lines
description:
This data shows the location of intersection screen lines used to count bicycle and pedestrian traffic. There are two screen lines at each intersection.  In order to capture pedestrian and bicycle traffic in both directions, volunteers count the number of pedestrians and bicyclists that cross each screen line. Screen lines are linked to intersections by a count location ID


Link to Attribute Table Information: http://gis.hennepin.us/OpenData/Metadata/PedestrianCountScreenLines.pdf


Data updated: annually


This data (i) is furnished AS IS with no representation as to completeness or accuracy; (ii) is furnished with no warranty of any kind; and (iii) is not suitable for legal, engineering or surveying purposes. Hennepin County shall not be liable for any damage, injury or loss resulting from this data. General questions about this data set, including errors, omissions, corrections and/or updates should be directed to the Hennepin County GIS Office at 612-596-9484.

title: Bicycle Count Zones
description:
Each year, Hennepin County collects 48 hour bicycle counts for sites across either the northern (cycle B) or southern half (cycle A) of the county using MetroCount RoadPod tube counters. This dataset contains the boundaries of the two count zones. For more detailed information on bicycle traffic counts and the latest report, visit https://www.hennepin.us/residents/transportation/biking.


Link to Attribute Table Information: http://gis.hennepin.us/OpenData/Metadata/BicycleCountZones.pdf


This data (i) is furnished AS IS with no representation as to completeness or accuracy; (ii) is furnished with no warranty of any kind; and (iii) is not suitable for legal, engineering or surveying purposes. Hennepin County shall not be liable for any damage, injury or loss resulting from this data. General questions about this data set, including errors, omissions, corrections and/or updates should be directed to the Hennepin County GIS Office at 612-596-9484.

keyword: [u'open data', u'transportation', u'bikeways', u'pedestrian', u'traffic counts']
title: Bicycle Count Stations
description:
Each year, Hennepin County collects 48 hour bicycle counts for sites across either the northern (cycle B) or southern half (cycle A) of the county using MetroCount RoadPod tube counters. Additional locations, such as CIP counts may be added to a cycle. 48 hour counts are converted to AADB using data from six permanent bicycle counters across the county. For more detailed information related to methodology, and the latest report, visit https://www.hennepin.us/residents/transportation/biking.


Link to Attribute Table Information: http://gis.hennepin.us/OpenData/Metadata/BicycleCountStations.pdf


Data updated: annually

title: Bikeway Gaps
description:
Locations classified as bikeway gaps are short (1/2 mile or less) connections that are needed to ensure continuity in the bikeway system. This data corresponds with Appendix E of the Hennepin County 2040 bike plan, and shows the gap ID, initial gap score, and general planned facility type.


Link to Attribute Table Information: http://gis.hennepin.us/OpenData/Metadata/BikewayGaps.pdf

keyword: [u'open data', u'transportation', u'pedestrian', u'traffic counts', u'bikeways']
title: Pedstrian Count Intersections
description:
Since 2016, Hennepin County has organized counts at locations outside of Minneapolis, counting both pedestrians and bicyclists. These short term counts rely on volunteers collecting data over a two-hour window, from 4:00-6:00 PM during the second week of September each year. The raw data from the counts was then used to calculate estimated daily traffic (EDT) at each site, which means that 2-hour counts are extrapolated to understand larger trends in walking and biking. Hennepin County?s volunteer counts take place in conjunction with the City of Minneapolis pedestrian and bicycle counts. Hennepin County leads the initiative for all counts outside of the City of Minneapolis; however, the county still utilizes data for county roads within the City of Minneapolis. This data shows the EDT for pedestrians and bicyclists at each intersection, in all directions. For more detailed information related to methodology, and the latest report, visit https://www.hennepin.us/residents/transportation/walking.


Link to Attribute Table Information: http://gis.hennepin.us/OpenData/Metadata/PedestrianCountIntersections.pdf


Data updated: annually


This data (i) is furnished AS IS with no representation as to completeness or accuracy; (ii) is furnished with no warranty of any kind; and (iii) is not suitable for legal, engineering or surveying purposes. Hennepin County shall not be liable for any damage, injury or loss resulting from this data. General questions about this data set, including errors, omissions, corrections and/or updates should be directed to the Hennepin County GIS Office at 612-596-9484.
